definition: Zi Gong or Duanmu Ci 端木賜|端木赐[Duan1 mu4 Ci4] (520 BC-), disciple of Confucius
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
surname Gong
to offer tribute/tribute/gifts

sentences.english: Looking at it, Zi Gong felt it was out of convenance.
sentences.chinese: 子貢看見這樣的行徑，大不以爲然。

sentences.english: After class, Zi Gong found a chance to see Confucius alone.
sentences.chinese: 孔子的憂慮，全讓子貢看在眼裏。

sentences.english: But if only one was chosen, what would be in the above two?
sentences.chinese: 子貢就問，不能有三樣東西，只要兩樣呢？

sentences.english: In the name of a disciple of Confucius, Zi Gong asked to see Laodan.
sentences.chinese: 子貢以孔子弟子的身份往老聃處求見。

sentences.english: Zi Gong felt that they were irrational so he went back.
sentences.chinese: 子貢覺得這些人不可理喻，因此就回去了。

sentences.english: Zi Gong detected Confucius's worry from his face.
sentences.chinese: 孔子的憂慮，全讓子貢看在眼裏。

sentences.english: Zi-gong asked, "What do you think of me?"
sentences.chinese: 子貢問道，“我是怎樣的人呢？”

sentences.english: "On coming out, Zi-gong said, "The Master does not support him.
sentences.chinese: 子貢退出來，對冉有說，“老師不會幫助衛君。”
